verses.verse: {God is Unique and Eternal} d "Bel {I. e. the Babylonian sun god Marduk} bows down, Nebo {I. e. Nabu, the Babylonian god of astronomy and learning, son of Marduk} stoops low. Their idols are on beasts, on {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read and on} livestock. Your loads are more burdensome than their reports. {So 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa b MT LXX read burdensome, a load for the weary}
They stoop, they bow down together, and {So 1QIsa a ; MT lacks and} they are not able to rescue the burden, but they themselves go off {So 1QIsa a LXX (pl.); 4QIsa b MT (sing.)} into captivity.
"Listen {So 1QIsa a (sing.); MT LXX (pl.)} to me, house of Jacob, and all you remnant of the house of Israel, who have been upheld from before your birth, and who have been carried from the womb.

Even {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads and even} until your {1QIsa a MT LXX lack your} old age, I am the one, and I'll carry you even until your gray hairs come. {1QIsa a MT LXX lack come} It is I who have created, {Or made} and I who will carry, and it is I who will bear and save.
"To whom will you compare me, count me equal, {So 1QIsa a (sing.); 1QIsa b MT read consider equal (pl.); LXX reads see} or liken me, so that I {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads we} may be compared?

Those who pour out gold in {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read from} a purse, weigh silver in a balance, hire a goldsmith in order to make {So 1QIsa a LXX; 4QIsa b MT read make it} a god, and then {Lit. and ; so 1QIsa a 1QIsa b LXX; MT lacks then} they bow down and even worship it.

And {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX lack And} they lift it on their shoulders, carry it, set it up in its place, and there it stands. It cannot move {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads one cannot remove it} from that spot. One may even call to {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads may cry out} it, but it cannot answer nor save him from his distress.
"Remember this, and stand firm; take it again to heart, you rebels.
Remember the former things from long ago, Because I am God, and there is no one else; I am God, and there is none like me.

I declare from the beginning things to follow, {So 1QIsa a LXX 4QIsa c ; MT reads the future} and from ancient times things that have not yet been done; saying, Â«My purpose will stand, and he {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b 4QIsa c MT LXX read I} will accomplish everything that I please.'

I am calling a bird of prey from the east, and from a far country a man with his {So 1QIsa a 4QIsa d MT; 1QIsa b MT (vocalization) LXX read of my} purpose. Indeed, I've spoken; I will certainly make it happen; I've planned it; {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b 4QIsa c MT LXX lack it} and I will certainly carry it out.
"Listen to me, you hard-hearted, you who are far removed from righteousness:

My righteousness is brought near {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX 4QIsa c read I have brought near;} and {So 1QIsa a ; MT lacks and} it's not far off, and my salvation won't delay. I'll {So 1QIsa a LXX; 1QIsa b 4QIsa c MT read And I} grant salvation in Zion, and {So 1QIsa a 4QIsa c ; 1QIsa b 4QIsa d MT LXX lack and} to Israel, my glory."
